alert.note: Alert for Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 7:24PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Indiana, including the following area, Porter. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 621 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy showers and thunderstorms continuing. The heaviest rainfall was located near Valparaiso to near Westville, with rain rates over one inch in 30 minutes. Up to 2.0 inches of rain has fallen in isolated areas near Valparaiso. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Portage, Valparaiso, Chesterton, Lakes of the Four Seasons, South Haven, and Wheeler. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
